Lesson 1: Understanding Variables

Variables in programming are containers for storing data values.

In Java, variables have a data type, which specifies what kind of data it can hold.

For example, int is a data type for storing integers, and String is a data type for storing text.

Variables are declared by specifying the data type, followed by the variable name.

For example, int age; declares a variable named age of type int.

Variables can also be initialized with a value when declared.

For example, int age = 25; declares a variable named age of type int and initializes it with the value 25.

Variables can be used to store different types of data, such as numbers, text, and boolean values.

Understanding how to use variables is fundamental to writing Java programs.
